sorular.soru: In which season are you most likely to encounter damaged road surface?

feedback.metin: The presence of frost means it is easier to damage the road surface. The water that sits between the asphalt in wetter periods expands in case of frost and damages the asphalt. So in winter you have more chance of encountering damaged road surface than in summer or autumn. Adjust your speed if you notice that the road surface has been damaged.

sorular.soru: You encounter this sign. How do you reduce the risk of a collision with wildlife?
cevaplar: By using the horn at regular intervals.

feedback.metin: To avoid a collision, it is best to reduce your speed to a maximum of 60 km/h. At this speed, wildlife on the road has a chance to dodge your vehicle and you will be able to swerve or come to a stop safely if necessary. If you see animals ahead of you, turn on your hazard lights to warn traffic behind you. Do not use full-beam headlights, as these can blind wildlife and hinder their escape.

sorular.soru: What is the primary cause of accidents?

feedback.metin: The primary cause of accidents is human error. This includes fatigue, carelessness, overconfidence, use of mobile devices, and use of alcohol or drugs.

sorular.soru: Why does a vehicle consume more energy at higher speeds?

feedback.metin: The higher the speed of the vehicle, the greater the drag. As a result, it takes more energy to keep the vehicle moving. The engine often gets a little warmer at higher speeds, but this does not have a negative effect on energy consumption. Braking has no effect on energy consumption; acceleration consumes much more. In electrically powered cars, braking can even be used to generate energy.

sorular.soru: Is parking allowed here if you live here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park in front of an entrance or exit, not even your own.

sorular.soru: How can you let a hesitant pedestrian know that you plan to stop at a pedestrian crossing?
cevaplar: By giving a light signal with your full-beam headlights.

feedback.metin: Some pedestrians wait briefly before crossing at pedestrian crossings because they are afraid drivers may not give way to them. If you see a pedestrian hesitating, use a friendly hand gesture to indicate that you have seen them and you are stopping. Using a light signal is prohibited in this situation because there is no need to avert imminent danger.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to drop off a passenger?

feedback.metin: Normally, stopping at a bus stop with a passenger car is only allowed to drop off or pick up passengers immediately. However, stopping on or directly next to a bus lane is prohibited. So if the bus stop is on a bus lane, you may not stop to let passengers get on or off.

sorular.soru: Which part is called the blind spot?

feedback.metin: Part A is the area to the left in front of the vehicle. The driver has sufficient visibility of this area, with only a small section behind the angle of the windscreen and side window not directly visible. The driver also has a sufficient view of part C via the left mirror. In part B, the driver does not have a direct view. This is called the blind spot. To get a clear view of this, the driver has to turn his head and look over his shoulder.

sorular.soru: What should you always have with you while driving?
cevaplar: Your original valid and legible vehicle registration card only.
Your original valid and legible driving licence only.
Your original valid and legible driving licence and vehicle registration card.
sorular.dogruCevap: Your original valid and legible driving licence and vehicle registration card.

feedback.metin: As a driver of a motor vehicle, you must always carry your driving licence and the vehicle registration card. These must be original and undamaged. A copy is not sufficient. The vehicle registration card contains details of the vehicle and its owner. The card has a nine-digit registration code which is required to sell the vehicle.

sorular.soru: What speed must a motor vehicle be capable of and allowed to travel at to drive on the motorway?

feedback.metin: Motor vehicles must be capable of and allowed to travel at a minimum of 60 km/h to drive on the motorway. On autowegen motor vehicles must be capable of and allowed to travel at a minimum of 50 km/h.

sorular.soru: After an accident, a driver complains of neck pain. What should you do?
cevaplar: You let the driver get out of the car and make him lie on the ground.
With the help of bystanders, get the person out of the car and lay him flat on the ground.
Keep them in the car and hold their head.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep them in the car and hold their head.

feedback.metin: You should move victims of a crash as little as possible. Does someone complain about neck or back pain? Then you never take them out of the car, unless keeping them in the car is more dangerous. Think of a fire or when they are on a railroad crossing. Sit behind (or in front) of the victim and hold their head so that they cannot move it anymore.

sorular.soru: What should you do?
cevaplar: Drive on smoothly, allowing the bus to pull up behind you.
Slow down and let the bus go ahead.
sorular.dogruCevap: Drive on smoothly, allowing the bus to pull up behind you.

feedback.metin: The rule that says you must give way to buses indicating that they want to leave a bus stop only applies in built-up areas. You are driving outside a built-up area, so the bus must give way to you.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to give way to a tram coming from the left on a equivalent intersection?

feedback.metin: At an equivalent intersection, you must always give way to a tram. It does not matter whether it comes from the right, the left, the front or the back.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn right here?

feedback.metin: The yellow sign indicates a detour. You are not required to follow this sign, which means you can turn right here.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a defective speedometer?

feedback.metin: A properly functioning and readable speedometer is mandatory.

sorular.soru: How should you warn road users behind you when you encounter a traffic jam?

feedback.metin: If you encounter a traffic jam, you must use your hazard lights to warn traffic behind you. Keep your hazard lights on until you observe the vehicles behind you passing on the warning with their own hazard lights or until they stop close behind you.

sorular.soru: Does a tram fall under the category of motor vehicles?

feedback.metin: Motor vehicles are all motorised vehicles intended to be moved without the use of rails, with the exception of mopeds and snorfietsen, bicycles with pedal assistance and disabled vehicles. Trams therefore do not fall under the category of motor vehicles.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?
cevaplar: You must keep following the police vehicle.
You must stop at a safe place.
You must stop as soon as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: You must keep following the police vehicle.

feedback.metin: If you are driving behind a police vehicle with an illuminated board displaying the text "POLITIE VOLGEN", you must follow the police vehicle. When the text "POLITIE STOP" is shown, you must stop in a safe place at the earliest opportunity.

sorular.soru: Can you transport suitcases on a car's bicycle carrier?
cevaplar: Yes, anything the size of a bicycle or smaller may be transported on a bicycle carrier.
No, only bicycles can be transported on a bicycle carrier.
Only if the suitcases are designed to be transported on a bicycle carrier.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, only bicycles can be transported on a bicycle carrier.

feedback.metin: Only items for which the load carrier is officially intended may be carried on a load carrier. A bicycle carrier may therefore only be used to transport bicycles, not suitcases.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: You are unable to see any oncoming vehicles. Overtaking here would be dangerous and is therefore forbidden.

sorular.soru: Are you always required to give way to a blind person who wants to cross the road?

feedback.metin: Drivers should always give way to the blind who want to cross. This also applies to "people with limited mobility".

sorular.soru: Is merging a special manoeuvre?

feedback.metin: Entering the main carriageway from the acceleration lane is a special manoeuvre. You must adapt your speed as much as possible to match traffic on the main carriageway. Traffic on the main carriageway has right of way. Only indicate the direction at the moment you are actually going to merge.

sorular.soru: How many children of 1.40 metres tall are allowed to sit here?

feedback.metin: Children from 1.35 metres tall are allowed to sit in the vehicle without a child safety device. As this rear seat has two seats with a seat belt, only two passengers are allowed to sit here.

sorular.soru: What is the correct way to wear a seatbelt?
cevaplar: As close to your neck as possible.
Without slack around your hip and chest.
Without slack around your hip and under your armpit.
sorular.dogruCevap: Without slack around your hip and chest.

feedback.metin: You tighten your seatbelt around your hip after fastening it. The roll-up system makes sure that it sits across your chest with no slack. Always wear your seatbelt over your collarbone, in between your shoulder and neck. Make sure the seatbelt is not too close to your neck and never wear your seatbelt under your armpit. If you do, the seatbelt does not keep your upper body in place during a collision and the chances are that you will hit your head against the dashboard or windshield. This can lead to serious injuries or even death.

sorular.soru: Which driving licence is required to drive a vehicle with a maximum authorised mass of 2500 kg, combined with a trailer with a maximum authorised mass of 1500 kg?

feedback.metin: If the maximum authorised mass of the trailer is up to and including 750 kg, a B licence is sufficient. However, in this combination, the maximum authorised mass of the trailer is more than 750kg. You must then look at the maximum authorised mass of the total combination. If it is less than 3500 kg, then driving licence B is still sufficient. In this case, the combination is heavier, namely 4000 kg. You, therefore, need a B licence in combination with an E licence. If the trailer on itself is heavier than 3500 kg, an E and B licence combination is insufficient and you will require a C1E licence.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?
cevaplar: Only stop if children enter the road.
Slow down and prepare to stop immediately if necessary.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down and prepare to stop immediately if necessary.

feedback.metin: Children often play in the street and surrounding area. They may play between parked cars and are usually not paying attention to traffic. If a ball rolls onto the road, it is likely that children will follow. The children are not paying attention to traffic, which means they may unexpectedly enter the road.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park on a cycle lane?

feedback.metin: Stopping on a cycle lane or on the carriageway next to a cycle lane is prohibited. You are not allowed to park there either.

sorular.soru: Can the motorcyclist overtake you like this?

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to drive between cars in slow-moving and stationary traffic jams if the difference in speed does not exceed 10 km/h and if it is done carefully. This is only allowed between the two left-hand lanes.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light is displayed on your dashboard?
cevaplar: Stop and fasten your seat belt.
Nothing. This means that the passenger airbag has been disabled.
Stop and call the garage or breakdown service.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop and call the garage or breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If this light is on in your dashboard, it means that the airbag or the seat belt pre-tensioners have malfunctioned. In this case it is wise to stop driving, as you may be less protected in the event of an accident. Stop in a safe place and call the garage or breakdown service.

sorular.soru: What is not allowed with both a broken and a solid yellow side line?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to park next to both the broken and solid yellow sidelines. It is still allowed to stop at the broken sideline, but only for loading and unloading there, or picking up or dropping off passengers. You are not allowed to do that at a solid yellow line.

sorular.soru: Are you driving well here?
cevaplar: No. You must drive further to the right.
Yes. You are driving well here.
No. You must drive further to the left.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You are driving well here.

feedback.metin: Yellow temporary lineation is above the white lineation. The carriageways here are temporarily shifted to the left, so you are driving in the middle of the right lane. Your position is good.

sorular.soru: Is this heavy load properly placed in the trailer?
cevaplar: No, the load should be placed at the very back of the trailer.
Yes, this is the best position for the load.
No, the load should be placed at the very front of the trailer.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, this is the best position for the load.

feedback.metin: The load is placed properly in this situation. If you are transporting a heavier load in a trailer, it is important that the load is placed as low as possible in the trailer. It should also be placed as far above the axle as possible to ensure that the drawbar load is not too high or too low.

sorular.soru: Are you well-positioned in case of a breakdown?

feedback.metin: In the event of an emergency, you can use the hard shoulder or refuge. Turn on your hazard lights and use the warning triangle as an additional safety measure. Always park your vehicle as far to the right as possible on the hard shoulder or on the verge. If you are able to continue driving to a parking lot, this is always preferable. However, in the event of a flat tyre, this is not possible.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake this lorry?

feedback.metin: Despite there being solid line, you are allowed to overtake this lorry. You may ignore the solid line between the rush hour lane and the carriageway when the rush hour lane is opened. Thus, you are allowed to cross this.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: The E-2 sign indicates that you are not allowed to stop on that side of the road. However, this does not apply to parking spaces or a parking strip. If there is a parking lane on the side where the sign E-2 is located, you may park in it.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this here?
cevaplar: Yes. You are allowed to overtake on the cycle lane here.
No. You are not allowed to overtake on the right here.
No. This is only allowed in a suggestion cycle lane.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You are allowed to overtake on the cycle lane here.

feedback.metin: If possible, you may overtake a turning car on the right. You may use the cycle lane because it is marked by a broken line. You may not obstruct cyclists and snorfiets riders. A cycle lane with a solid line may not be used for this purpose. In that case, you should not have overtaken.

sorular.soru: What do these zigzag lines on the road mean?
cevaplar: Warning of a dangerous traffic situation.
Warning of an unguarded level crossing.
sorular.dogruCevap: Warning of a dangerous traffic situation.

feedback.metin: The zigzag line means that you are approaching a dangerous traffic situation. It says nothing about the priority. What it does mean is that it is best to reduce your speed.
